name: Hostile Persuasion Resistance
description: Training in resisting coercive persuasion, manipulation tactics, and psychological pressure designed to override free will.

cards.title: Identifying Coercion Tactics
cards.description: Recognizing methods used to pressure individuals into compliance.
bulletpoints: Analyze pressure points used in high-stakes persuasion attempts.
Recognize false dilemmas designed to limit perception of choices.
Identify escalation tactics that create a sense of urgency and fear.
cards.summaryText: Spot the coercion tells, dismantle false choices, and call out manufactured urgency.

cards.title: Countering Guilt and Shame Manipulation
cards.description: Neutralizing tactics that use guilt, shame, and social obligation to manipulate behavior.
bulletpoints: Separate emotional triggers from logical decision-making.
Recognize virtue-signaling and weaponized morality used to control actions.
Deploy strategic disengagement to avoid emotional entrapment.
cards.summaryText: Separate feelings from facts, expose moral bait, and step out before you're hooked.

cards.title: Overcoming Psychological Pressure
cards.description: Building resilience against aggressive persuasion strategies.
bulletpoints: Practice controlled breathing techniques to resist stress-induced compliance.
Use mental distancing methods to maintain an objective perspective.
Deploy mirroring and deflection to neutralize persuasion pressure.
cards.summaryText: Steady the breath, zoom out mentally, and mirror back pressure until it collapses.

cards.title: Recognizing and Resisting NLP Manipulation
cards.description: Understanding how Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) is used in coercive persuasion.
bulletpoints: Detect embedded commands hidden within normal speech patterns.
Interrupt rapport-building sequences used for subconscious influence.
Counteract hypnotic language patterns designed to lower defenses.
cards.summaryText: Catch the embedded commands, break the rapport spell, and block trance-language loops.

cards.title: Defending Against Gaslighting
cards.description: Neutralizing tactics designed to make you question reality.
bulletpoints: Establish baseline reality-checking techniques to counter false narratives.
Reject forced reinterpretations of past events meant to distort truth.
Use written records and third-party validation to expose gaslighting.
cards.summaryText: Anchor to documented reality, refuse rewrites, and pull receipts to end the gaslight.

cards.title: Dealing with Love-Bombing and Trust Manipulation
cards.description: Resisting excessive flattery, false affection, and manipulative trust-building.
bulletpoints: Identify artificial bonding and over-exaggerated praise.
Test for inconsistency between words and long-term actions.
Set firm boundaries to prevent emotional dependency conditioning.
cards.summaryText: Call out love-bomb theatrics, test promises against behavior, and lock in boundaries.

cards.title: Resisting Fear-Based Persuasion
cards.description: Avoiding manipulation tactics that exploit fear and anxiety.
bulletpoints: Recognize crisis-exploitation rhetoric used to push compliance.
Identify false catastrophization techniques used in persuasive narratives.
Reframe perceived threats into manageable strategic challenges.
cards.summaryText: Decode fear scripts, downgrade the doom talk, and reframe threats into plans.

cards.title: Mental Armor: Strengthening Internal Convictions
cards.description: Developing an unshakable mindset resistant to persuasion.
bulletpoints: Clarify personal principles and ensure they remain non-negotiable.
Strengthen cognitive autonomy through regular critical-thinking drills.
Use thought-loop interruption to prevent gradual erosion of beliefs.
cards.summaryText: Lock in your core code, drill autonomy daily, and break loops before they dig in.

cards.title: Recognizing and Resisting Social Engineering Attacks
cards.description: Detecting deception and manipulation in social interactions.
bulletpoints: Identify pretexting tactics used to build false credibility.
Counter emotional exploitation used to extract information or compliance.
Train in micro-expression analysis to detect concealed intent.
cards.summaryText: Read the pretext, block emotional hooks, and scan faces for the tells they hide.

cards.title: The Art of Non-Engagement
cards.description: Mastering disengagement techniques to neutralize coercion attempts.
bulletpoints: Use controlled ambiguity to avoid direct persuasion battles.
Deploy strategic silence to create psychological space and regain control.
Redirect conversations to neutral topics to disrupt manipulation attempts.
cards.summaryText: Fade out of the trap with ambiguity, let silence reset the field, and pivot the dialogue.
